intro: Argyreia lakshminarasimhanii, commonly known as the Lakshminarasimhanii morning glory, is a flowering plant native to India. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant is a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms that open in the early morning. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its rarity, it is also of interest to botanists and conservationists.
